name: arrogantly
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is unpleasantly proud and shows you think you are more important than, or know more than, other people: The authorities had behaved arrogantly, she said. The council is arrogantly pushing its failed special-interest agenda. See
arrogant
More examplesFewer examplesHe's a selfish and arrogantly self-righteous man.Teachers should set an example, not arrogantly, but cooperatively. I think of myself, probably arrogantly, as an educational leader.He spent his time partying rather than studying, and arrogantly believed he could bluff his way through.
